changeRootPass_h.help1Txt1: Enter a password for the administrator or root user, and then re-enter it to confirm.
changeRootPass_h.help1Txt2: User name - Shows the administrator or root user.
changeRootPass_h.help2Txt2: Confirm Password - Confirm the above password here.
changeRootPass_h.help3Txt: Note: This password will be stored in a format which may be incompatibile with older firmware. If downgrading to a prior firmware is necessary, the administrator or root user may not be able to log in to the product. To regain access a reset to factory default settings are required.

users_h.introAudioTxt: To prevent unauthorized use of the Axis product, the product supports multi-user password protection, where access can be restricted to defined users only.
users_h.introTxt1: To prevent unauthorized use of the product, the product supports multi-user password protection, where access can be restricted to defined users only (maximum of
users_h.intro_fortsTxt: An Administrator has unrestricted access to the product's administration tools and can determine the registration and rights for all other users.
users_h.intro_authTxt1: The product supports several methods of user authentication. These are:
users_h.intro_authTxt2: HTTP Basic Authentication - This authenticates the user by requesting a user name and a password. The exchange of network credentials is in simple base64 coding and is not encrypted.
users_h.intro_authTxt3: HTTP Digest Authentication - This method also requests a user name and password, but the exchange of credentials is encrypted, which makes it much more secure against eavesdropping.
users_h.intro_authTxt4: Note: The HTTP Basic and HTTP Digest authentication methods are also used for RTSP network traffic.
users_h.listTxt1: The User list displays all of the users authorized to use the server. The administrator user name root is permanent and cannot be deleted. This user is also the only one allowed access to the product via FTP.
users_h.listTxt2: The list also indicates if a user is only configured for unencrypted passwords. Note that all new or modified users will automatically receive encrypted passwords.
users_h.listTxt3: To add a new user, click the Add button. To modify or delete an existing user, select the user from the list and click the relevant button. See also Adding and modifying users.
users_h.passwordTxt1: Allow password type: Select the type of password to allow. You may need to allow unencrypted passwords if there are viewing clients that do not support encryption, or if you recently upgraded the firmware and the existing clients do support encryption, but need to log in again and be configured to use this functionality.
users_h.passwordTxt3: Encrypted & unencrypted (default value for new unit or unit reset to factory default settings)
users_h.passwordTxt5: Unencrypted only (default value for upgraded unit) - the password is sent in plain text and it may be possible to eavesdrop on the network transmission. This is also the only value allowed if the user root uses an unencrypted password.
users_h.anonTxt: Anonymous viewer login means that anybody on the network can access the product and its images (but not the Setup tools) from a browser, and without having to log in. To allow this, check the box for Enable anonymous viewer login.
users_h.max_viewersTxt1: Maximum number of simultaneous viewers limited to: Limiting the number of viewers accessing the server at any one time can be useful if there are limitations on the available bandwidth. The maximum of
users_h.max_viewersTxt2: viewers means that subsequent viewers will not see the video stream, but instead a blank image.
users_h.multicast_viewersTxt1: Note that all multicast viewers count as one user in the total limit of
users_h.ptzTxt: Enable anonymous PTZ control login - This option allows anonymous users to gain control of the PTZ controls provided by the product.
users_h.basic_SetupTxt: Enable Basic Setup - To quickly access setup settings enable the shortcut list Basic Setup in the menu. Note that most settings require Administrator access privileges.

users_set_h.help1Txt1: Provide the following information for each new user:
users_set_h.help1Txt2: User Name - User names can contain from one to fourteen characters. Valid characters are: A-Z, a-z, 0-9. Note that, the first character in the user name must be A-Z or a-z.
users_set_h.help1Txt5: Confirm Password - Confirm the above password here.
users_set_h.help2Txt1: User Group - Click the appropriate radio button to define the access rights for the user; where the level of access can be described as follows:
users_set_h.help2Txt2: Viewer - Allows access to the video stream only.
users_set_h.help2Txt3: Operator - An Operator can view the video stream, create and modify event types, and also modify all the settings not included in the System options.
users_set_h.operatorRightsNoMaskdTxt: Operator - An Operator has unrestricted access to all settings except those for creating and modifying PTZ presets, PTZ control settings, uploading applications and language files, and for modifying any of the settings included in the System options.
users_set_h.operatorRightsMaskdTxt: Operator - An Operator has unrestricted access to all settings except those for creating and modifying Privacy masks, PTZ presets, PTZ control settings, uploading applications and language files, and for modifying any of the settings included in the System options.
users_set_h.help2Txt4: Administrator - An Administrator has unrestricted access to the whole product and its setup Tools, and can thus determine the registration of all other users.
users_set_h.help3Txt: Enable PTZ control - Checking this option will allow this user to have access to the PTZ controls.
users_set_h.help_ciWrn: Note:This user's password will be stored in a format that may be incompatible with earlier firmware releases if a downgrade is needed.
